template.template: Template App MS SQL DB Discovery
template.name: Template App MS SQL DB Discovery

discovery_rule.name: MS SQL DB Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovers databases within a single instance specified in a Powershell script.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Active Transactions
item_prototype.description: Number of active transactions for the database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Bulk Copy Rows/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of rows bulk copied per second.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Bulk Copy Throughput/sec
item_prototype.description: Amount of data bulk copied (in kilobytes) per second.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Commit Table Entries
item_prototype.description: The size of the in-memory portion of the commit table for the database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Data File(s) Size (KB)
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the data files in the database including any automatic growth. Monitoring this counter is useful, for example, for determining the correct size of tempdb.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} DBCC Logical Scan Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of logical read scan bytes per second for database console commands (DBCC).

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Cache Hit Ratio
item_prototype.description: Percentage of log cache reads satisfied from the log cache.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Cache Reads/sec
item_prototype.description: Reads performed per second through the log manager cache.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log File(s) Size (KB)
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log File(s) Used Size (KB)
item_prototype.description: The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Flushes/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of log flushes per second.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Flush Waits/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of commits per second waiting for the log flush.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DBS} Log Flush Waits/sec
trigger_prototype.description: The number of times per second that SQL Server must wait for pages to be written to the transaction log.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Flush Wait Time
item_prototype.description: Total wait time (in milliseconds) to flush the log. On an AlwaysOn secondary database, this value indicates the wait time for log records to be hardened to disk.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DBS} Log Flush Wait Time
trigger_prototype.description: Total wait time, in milliseconds, to write all transaction log pages.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Flush Write Time (ms)
item_prototype.description: Time in milliseconds for performing writes of log flushes that were completed in the last second.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Growths
item_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been expanded.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DBS} Log Growths
trigger_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been expanded. Each time the transaction log grows, all user activity must halt until the log growth completes. Therefore, you want log growths to occur during predefined maintenance windows rather than during general working hours

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Pool Cache Misses/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of requests for which the log block was not available in the log pool. The log pool is an in-memory cache of the transaction log. This cache is used to optimize reading the log for recovery, transaction replication, rollback, and AlwaysOn Availability Groups.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Pool Disk Reads/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of disk reads that the log pool issued to fetch log blocks.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Pool Requests/sec
item_prototype.description: The number of log-block requests processed by the log pool.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Shrinks
item_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been shrunk.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DBS} Log Shrinks
trigger_prototype.description: Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been shrunk.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Log Truncations
item_prototype.description: The number of times the transaction log has been shrunk.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Percent Log Used
item_prototype.description: Percentage of space in the log that is in use.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DBS} Percent Log Used
trigger_prototype.description: Percentage of space in the log that is in use. Since all work in an OLTP database stops until writes can occur to the transaction log, itâ€™s a very good idea to ensure that the log never fills completely. Hence, the recommendation to keep the log under 80% full.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Repl. Pending Xacts
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions in the transaction log of the publication database marked for replication, but not yet delivered to the distribution database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Repl. Trans. Rate
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions per second read out of the transaction log of the publication database and delivered to the distribution database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Shrink Data Movement Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Amount of data being moved per second by autoshrink operations, or DBCC SHRINKDATABASE or DBCC SHRINKFILE statements.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Tracked transactions/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of committed transactions recorded in the commit table for the database.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Transactions/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions started for the database per second.

item_prototype.name: {$INSTANCE01} Databases {#DBS} Write Transactions/sec
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions that wrote to the database and committed, in the last second.
